title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 14 January 2015 - XWiki
content:

10:03 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
10:07 <vmassol> sdumitriu: ping  
10:11 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
10:15 <lucaa> has quit  
10:22 <fmancinelli> has joined #xwiki  
10:27 <tmortagne> has quit  
10:27 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
10:54 <woshilapin> has quit  
10:54 <woshilapin> has joined #xwiki  
10:56 <vmassol> good morning  
10:56 <vmassol> strange I can't find MacroDescriptor in the javadoc we genertae at http://rendering.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/JavaDoc  
10:57 <vmassol> the org.xwiki.rendering.macro package is not even listed  
11:03 <Enygma`> has quit  
11:04 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
11:11 <evalica> when creating a new repo on xwiki-contrib. Does anyone knows how to set up the Webhooks part in Settings? Is it automatical? How can I get the URL for the jira project?  
11:32 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
12:05 <msmeria1> has joined #xwiki  
12:08 <ClemensR> has joined #xwiki  
12:08 <msmeria> has quit  
12:09 <ClemensR> evalica: thanks for creating the repo and Jira :)  
12:12 <evalica> ClemensR: np - hope everything work fine. There is a configuration I don't know how to make :) but maybe it's automatic - we'll see  
12:13 <ClemensR> yes, I will see, too :)  - and I should be able to help myself with the config  
12:51 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
12:54 <gdelhumeau> mflorea: what is the status for the release?  
12:55 <gdelhumeau> I have discovered XWIKI-11655 which is a blokcer  
12:55 <gdelhumeau> and XWIKI-11497 which is critical  
13:02 <ClemensR> meh, wrong extension id :-/  
13:15 <mflorea> gdelhumeau: I'd rather leave them for 6.4 final  
13:15 <gdelhumeau> ok for me  
13:15 <mflorea> I'm still trying to fix the failing tests  
13:17 <Slashman\_> has joined #xwiki

14:18 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki

14:42 <tmortagne> has quit  
14:46 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
14:48 <tmortagne> has quit  
14:48 <OSIMasson> has joined #xwiki  
14:50 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
15:06 <mkolenda> has joined #xwiki  
15:28 <KermitTheFragger> has joined #xwiki  
15:38 <silverdrop> has quit  
15:44 <lucaa> has quit  
15:52 <OSIMasson> has quit  
15:52 <OSIMasson> has joined #xwiki  
15:56 <sdumitriu> vmassol: Pong  
15:57 <vmassol> sdumitriu: thanks. We now have botbotme record our irc chat  
15:57 <vmassol> https://botbot.me/freenode/xwiki/  
15:57 <sdumitriu> Yes, looked at it yestrday  
15:57 <vmassol> and one rule they ask us to follow is to add a given URL to our channel welcome message  
15:58 <vmassol> I tried to add it but I don't have the permissions  
15:58 <sdumitriu> Yes, because you need to register your account  
15:58 <sdumitriu> I told you to do that several times :)  
15:59 <vmassol> yeah I know  
15:59 <vmassol> it's enough?  
15:59 <gdelhumeau> /msg nickserv register :)  
16:00 <sdumitriu> Not enough, but then I can tell chanserv to give you rights  
16:00 <vmassol> then I can use /msg chanserv set #xwiki URL <urlhere> ?  
16:00 <sdumitriu> Unregistered nicks are not safe, so it's not allowed to give them any rights  
16:00 <vmassol> ahah I knew you had to do something :)  
16:02 <vmassol> hmm /msg NickServ REGISTER password [[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection) didn't work  
16:02 <vmassol> my bad  
16:03 <sdumitriu> Seems that only me and cjd have the right to change the topic right now, as full owners of #xwiki  
16:05 <sdumitriu> You're an owner now as well  
16:05 <vmassol> ok my nick is now registered  
16:05 <sdumitriu> But in order to be able to use your privileges, you must authenticate first  
16:06 <sdumitriu> You should set your client to do that automatically  
16:08 <vmassol> thanks sdumitriu  
16:09 <sdumitriu> You're welcome  
16:10 <vmassol> "(notice) You are not authorized to execute this command."  
16:10 <vmassol> for: /msg chanserv set #xwiki URL https://botbot.me/freenode/xwiki/  
16:10 <vmassol> any idea?  
16:11 <gdelhumeau> just do /topic "your topic"  
16:11 <vmassol> is that going to be permanent?  
16:11 <gdelhumeau> it should be  
16:12 <sdumitriu> vmassol: Try again  
16:13 <gdelhumeau> /msg chanserv set keeptopic on  
16:13 <vmassol> with what gdelhumeau suggests or the full thing?  
16:13 <gdelhumeau> /msg chanserv set #xwiki keeptopic on  
16:13 <sdumitriu> The set URL thing  
16:14 <msmeria> has quit  
16:14 <vmassol> is that the same thing as the topic: "http://www.xwiki.org/ | http://www.xwiki.com | Most developers are online usually between 08-21 GMT | This channel is logged at http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/IRC/"?  
16:14 <vmassol> or is topic url different from topic text?  
16:14 <sdumitriu> It's different  
16:15 <vmassol> ok so I need to change both  
16:15 <vmassol> how do i get the current topic url?  
16:15 <vmassol> trying with get…  
16:16 <sdumitriu> There isn't one  
16:16 <vmassol> how do you know? :)  
16:16 <vmassol> (that's what I'm trying to find)  
16:17 <sdumitriu> It would be printed otherwise when joining the channel  
16:18 <vmassol> ok it worked  
16:18 <vmassol> now the question is: can we set 2 urls?  
16:18 <vmassol> is it a free text or does it have to be a URL  
16:18 <sdumitriu> Not really  
16:19 <vmassol> there's very little info about topic url when you google...  
16:19 <sdumitriu> You can set two URLs, as far as I can see  
16:20 <sdumitriu> It's just a string that gets printed, it's not used in any way  
16:20 <vmassol> ok I'll try  
16:20 <vmassol> done  
16:21 <vmassol> ah info command to get it  
16:22 <vmassol> cool works  
16:22 <vmassol> to see it: /msg ChanServ info #xwiki  
16:22 <tmortagne> has quit  
16:22 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
16:23 <vmassol> now it's strange, on https://botbot.me/freenode/xwiki/ I don't see the logs from yesterday  
16:28 <tmortagne> vmassol: it was not enabled yesterday was it ?  
16:28 <vmassol> it was  
16:29 <tmortagne> then by yesterday you don't mean the whole day  
16:29 <vmassol> it started yesterday around 17:00 paris time  
16:29 <vmassol> right  
16:30 <vmassol> I don't see any logs for yesterday at all in the UI  
16:32 <tmortagne> vmassol: when I am on "this week" I can see yesterday logs  
16:32 <vmassol> indeed I can see them now  
16:32 <vmassol> I had some empty page before  
16:32 <vmassol> cool  
16:33 <vmassol> same as if I click on a January I still get an empty page  
16:33 <vmassol> mm this week too is now empty  
16:33 <OSIMasson> has quit  
16:33 <vmassol> the ui seems to have problemes at least with my chrome  
16:34 <vmassol> same with FF  
16:34 <tmortagne> it starts with "jonitrythall[d\_\_d] ping"  
16:34 <tmortagne> at 5:30  
16:34 <tmortagne> pm  
16:34 <tmortagne> (but not those from today, but I guess it's how it's working)  
16:34 <ClemensR> it might also have a different idea of "this week" than humans  
16:35 <ClemensR> I can see yesterdays logs at https://botbot.me/freenode/xwiki/2015-01-13/  
16:35 <vmassol> again I have only "current" working  
16:35 <vmassol> (when I click in the UI)  
16:35 <ClemensR> but not at https://botbot.me/freenode/xwiki/2015-01-12/  
16:35 <vmassol> indeed  
16:35 <ClemensR> (entered the first url manually ...)  
16:35 <vmassol> yep manually crafted URLs work  
16:36 <ClemensR> so maybe it will work next week  
16:36 <vmassol> ok some limitation to know  
16:36 <vmassol> but at least it's logged  
16:36 <vmassol> search didn't find it though  
16:36 <vmassol> that's why I was worried  
16:36 <vmassol> for example:  
16:36 <vmassol> https://botbot.me/freenode/xwiki/search/?q=botbotme  
16:37 <vmassol> maybe because urls are not parsed...  
16:37 <vmassol> yes seems to be the reason  
16:38 <vmassol> searching for "trigger" does give a result for yesterday  
16:39 <tmortagne> has quit  
16:40 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
16:43 <vmassol> guys I have a question on indexes  
16:43 <vmassol> http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/Database+Administration gives a list of indexes to create for XWiki 4.3+  
16:43 <vmassol> is that true?  
16:43 <vmassol> I thought we were creating all of them automatically now  
16:43 <tmortagne> has quit  
16:44 <vmassol> I see this in xwiki.hbm.xml for xwl\_value for example:  
16:44 <vmassol> <property name="value" type="long" column="XWL\_VALUE" index="XWLONG\_VALUE" />  
16:44 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
16:44 <vmassol> this would tend to suppose that we don't need to create that index anymore even though the doc says so  
16:46 <vmassol> I see http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-7125 is still open too  
16:46 <vmassol> sdumitriu: you worked on indexes at some point, do you remember?  
16:47 <vmassol> in XWIKI-6685  
16:47 <vmassol> could it be that you forgot to update the documentation?  
16:48 <sdumitriu> Let me see  
16:49 <vmassol> "There are some more indexes that would be nice to have, but aren't critical. They can't be automatically created from the HBM since there are on a prefix (index on xwikidoc(xwd\_classxml(50)) for finding documents with classes, index on xwikidoc(xwd\_parent(255)) for searching for child documents). The problem is that these columns are longer than 255 chars, and indexes can't be created on such long columns."  
16:50 <vmassol> so are you saying that "index" attribute in the following is not having any effect:  
16:50 <vmassol> <property name="value" type="long" column="XWL\_VALUE" index="XWLONG\_VALUE" />  
16:50 <vmassol> and this is why the user still needs to run:  
16:50 <vmassol> create index xwl\_value on xwikilargestrings (xwl\_value(50));  
16:50 <vmassol> ?  
16:50 <sdumitriu> Yes  
16:51 <sdumitriu> But type="long" should be created OK...  
16:51 <vmassol> so "create index xwl\_value on xwikilargestrings (xwl\_value(50));" is not required?  
16:51 <sdumitriu> Only strings longer than 255 can't be indexed automatically  
16:52 <sdumitriu> There are different xwl\_value columns/tables  
16:52 <sdumitriu> The one you pasted above is from xwikilongs, which should be fine  
16:52 <vmassol> ah indeed missed that sorry  
16:52 <sdumitriu> The one on xwikilargestrings must be created manually  
16:52 <vmassol> ok so it seems the doc is still correct  
16:53 <vmassol> too bad...  
16:54 <sdumitriu> We can add automatic indexes on the stats tables  
16:55 <sdumitriu> xws\_number on xwikistatsdoc, xws\_classname on xwikistatsdoc, xwr\_number on xwikistatsreferer... All those that don't have a (nr) in the index creation line  
16:56 <vmassol> would be nice to add those indeed  
16:57 <vmassol> sdumitriu: trying to find the 255 limitation information in the hibernate doc  
16:57 <vmassol> if you know where it is...  
16:59 <sdumitriu> It's not in Hibernate, it's in MySQL  
17:03 <vmassol> sdumitriu: could you verify the infobox I added on http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/Database+Administration ?  
17:03 <vmassol> ah ok, changing the box  
17:05 <tmortagne> has quit  
17:05 <sdumitriu> vmassol: create index ase\_page\_date on activitystream\_events (ase\_page, ase\_date); must be created manually as well  
17:05 <sdumitriu> It spans two columns  
17:06 <vmassol> ok found the doc: http://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/5.6/en/column-indexes.html  
17:06 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
17:08 <sdumitriu> 767 bytes = 255 utf characters  
17:08 <vmassol> apparently it depends on the storage engine used  
17:08 <vmassol> (for the max indexing size)  
17:08 <vmassol> trying to find the max for innodb  
17:08 <vmassol> http://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/5.0/en/innodb-restrictions.html  
17:09 <vmassol> so 767 bytes , not more ....  
17:11 <sdumitriu> vmassol: did you see my reply above?  
17:11 <sdumitriu> vmassol: create index ase\_page\_date on activitystream\_events (ase\_page, ase\_date); must be created manually as well  
17:11 <vmassol> yep  
17:11 <vmassol> are you sure this cannot be expressed in the hbm?  
17:11 <vmassol> because it's possible apparently in java code with the hibernate annotations  
17:12 <sdumitriu> I'm not sure... I was wondering what happens if I use the same index name  
17:13 <sdumitriu> But then again, these already have individual indexes on the two columns  
17:14 <vmassol> actually I didn't check  
17:14 <vmassol> but maybe those indexes can be created automatically for DBs other than mysql  
17:14 <vmassol> (255 limit)  
17:15 <sdumitriu> vmassol: https://steveswinsburg.wordpress.com/2009/06/16/adding-database-indexes-with-hibernate/  
17:16 <vmassol> 2009  
17:16 <vmassol> oh I see  
17:16 <sdumitriu> https://docs.jboss.org/hibernate/stable/core.old/reference/en/html/mapping-database-object.html  
17:16 <vmassol> <database-object>  
17:16 <vmassol> nice  
17:16 <sdumitriu> Right  
17:16 <vmassol> so we could automate them all  
17:16 <vmassol> :)  
17:17 <sdumitriu> And with dialect-scope we can have different commands for different DBs  
17:17 <sdumitriu> In case the syntax is different  
17:17 <vmassol> btw on our wiki page we just put one syntax for all dbs...  
17:17 <sdumitriu> ...where "all" usually means "mysql"  
17:18 <vmassol> we officially support several dBs  
17:18 <vmassol> so we need to be clear about that  
17:18 <vmassol> ok I'll create a jira issue  
17:28 <vmassol> done: http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-11660  
17:29 <tmortagne> has quit  
17:30 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki
